stories.title: Low Overhead Structured Logging in C

stories.text:
I realized recently I find text flow in variable browser sizes very disorienting.

For example: the text on URL X on my phone is a lot easier for me to remember then the same URL on my laptop or desktop browser. This is because I'm always resizing my browser on a desktop or laptop while on my phone, the text is always on the same place when I read it. This is really helpful for remember for some reason.

Is there an extension or some pattern of browsing I can use to make sure my desktop experience is consistent across browsers? Something like "right click, set browser width to 120 ems"?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do I normalize text width as a client across devices?

stories.text:
Hi, This is Shreyansh, founder of Brix, am very excited to announce that we're now accepting requests for our full-stack non-custodial cryptocurrency payments and programmable payouts solution, which will do most of the legwork for you to make it easier to accept payments and manage payouts in cryptocurrencies on your e-commerce, SaaS, marketplace, platform app, or website, with high customizability, and easy-to-read code, to meet your brand needs.

A few months ago, I was asked by a client in my freelance work to integrate cryptocurrency payments in their marketplace website, I could find no solution, currently, we have solutions to accept cryptocurrency payments, of which none is non-custodial, none provides programmable payouts, none is developer-centric, none has subscriptions coming to them, that's why we built Brix.

I'm currently working all my free time, to make the solution open to everyone, making it more secure, introducing new features, creating a distributed open-source layer 2 network, and preparing the documentation. So, if you're interested in this you can sign-up for early access.

We're open to suggestions, feedback, and I'm looking for two individuals to join me in building Brix (specifically: Rust, Go, Full Stack Devs), as a co-founder.

https://brixpayments.com
stories.title: Launch: Brix – Full stack crypto payments solution
